OpenTypeMethods Class

Definition

Used to perform late-bound operations on open properties.

In this Article

public static class OpenTypeMethods
Inheritance
System.Object
OpenTypeMethods

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

This class is used when you implement a custom data service provider for WCF Data Services.

Methods

Add(Object,Object)

Adds two values.

public static object Add (object left, object right);
left
System.Object

First value to add.

right
System.Object

Second value to add.

Returns
System.Object

The result of the arithmetic operation.

Remarks

The Add method adds two values without overflow checking.

left
System.Object

Left value.

right
System.Object

Right value.

Returns
System.Object

The result of the logical and operation.

value

A Decimal or Double object.

Value to convert.

type

Returns

Remarks

The Convert method is used to perform a type cast on the specified value.

Determines whether the end of one string matches another string.

public static object EndsWith (object targetString, object substring);
targetString
System.Object

The string being compared.

substring
System.Object

The string to compare to.

Returns
System.Object

Returns true when targetString ends with substring; otherwise returns false.

Remarks

An error is raised when the parameters are not strings.

System.Object

right
System.Object

Returns
System.Object

A Boolean value of true when both objects are equal; otherwise false.

System.Object

propertyName

Name of property from which to get the value.

Returns
System.Object

The requested value; null if the value cannot be determined.

System.Object

The first value.

Remarks

The IndexOf method returns a null value when substring cannot be found in targetString.

Returns

Remarks

targetString
System.Object

The string being compared.

substring
System.Object

The substring that the targetString might start with.

Returns
System.Object

Returns true if the target string starts with the given substring, otherwise returns false.

Substring(Object,Object)

Returns the substring after the specified starting index location.

public static object Substring (object targetString, object startIndex);
targetString
System.Object

The string from which to return the substring.

startIndex
System.Object

The starting index for the substring.

Returns
System.Object

The substring.

Remarks

The Substring method returns all characters from startIndex through the end of the targetString.

Substring(Object,Object,Object)

Returns the substring of a specific length after the specified starting index location.

public static object Substring (object targetString, object startIndex, object length);
targetString
System.Object

The string from which to return the substring.

startIndex
System.Object

The starting index for the substring.

length
System.Object

The length of the substring.

Returns
System.Object

The substring.

Remarks

The Substring method returns the length number of characters from startIndex through the end of the targetString.

System.Object

System.Object
